::You bring Todd to the camp. You told him where he would be going and tried preparing him as best as you could to what he was going to encounter, but you knew he was inevitably going to be intimidated by his first encounter with the Outside, and such an overwhelming one at that. As you led him through the camp, everyone turned around and stared in utter disbelief at this man wearing a suit in a style everyone could by now identify as being Lemurian.

And Todd, he stared at them too, at all these strange people in this large room with a jagged ceiling...::
English

::He speaks to you, his stare distant and filled with excitement.::

By the caverns... I just talked to a... *Lemurian*!
It's over. It is finally over.
Excuse me, but who are you?
English
You great supine... protoplasmic invertebrate *jelly*! May this sea be your grave.
What are you doing here? Defend the camp!
By the caverns! One of the statue bots has been activated and is wreaking havoc in the camp!
I'm sorry, but there is nothing I can do. It's outside of my power.
$(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName).

Ah, $(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName) - come on in, come in. I have to say, if it weren't for your keen senses and swift action, that pirate attack could've ended in a disaster.

You saved my life, and for that you have my eternal gratitude.
You're here, $(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName). Good, good... Seeger just sent me the files.
Go to Seeger and get me those files.
You're still in one piece. Very good. What's Yahota's status?
::A spindly woman enters the tent, her movement so light you weren't even able to hear her footsteps. What follows her is the sound of a shrieking siren.::

::You find him packing.::

Please be quick, $(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName). We have no time to waste.

::The chief silently nods with his head slightly bowed. He then turns his attention to the professor.::

Do come in... $(context.player.Name), was it? Come in. I am Edward Oldfield, professor of Supercorporation History at the University of Dis. Also the man responsible for this whole expedition - or so I've been told. ::A smile peeks through his mustache.::

I had a question about collecting my pay.
Biocorp seems to have left most of the facilities untouched. How come they never entered them, not even after so much time? They had two centuries to do so.

Any new discoveries?

::, shaking his head in despair.::

::He gives you a barren stare - and then his eyes widen.::

::He bows his head in silence.::
::He grabs his head, and after a few seconds he tightly grasps his hair with his hands as his clenched teeth slightly show. His eyes reveal him to be elsewhere.::

Well... First and foremost, I have to admit that I am - how shall I express myself? - overjoyed with how you've performed so far. That is no hyperbole: What you've done for this expedition in such a short period of time is nothing short of incredible.
Yes, I was about to call you before the attack. But now I'm... Just give me a moment to recheck my notes.
Thank you. Farewell.
No... no. Go ahead.
But your safety always comes first, Professor.
Things could've been so much worse, all things considered.
::The chief turns to you. ::
Have the painkillers set in, Professor?
::He glances at the professor's wounds.:: You should see

explain to you what this whole expedition is about - what its purpose is - as well as the details of your first mission; for, after all, unless you have sufficient wider knowledge on the subject of our interest here, one cannot expect from you to perform optimally, can he?
I... think so. I haven't been this close to death since the Battle of Dis. Goodness me, Richard, there were so many of them. But their voices, that language...
Pirates?
::[Persuade]:: *The* Professor Oldfield? I've heard a lot about you from some of my friends. They said very good things about the quality of your lectures.
I thought this was the kitchen. I got really hungry during the boat ride.
Ah, yes, yes. I've been trying to reach you.

::After listening to you with great interest, only occasionally interjecting with various exclamations of surprise and awe, the professor shares his thoughts.::

Goodness me, that is marvelous indeed! Your descent down the elevator shaft, turning on the power, exploring the floors, all of it - truly incredible. And the fact that you managed to upgrade your microchip implant's clearance level with that... what did you say the device was called?

::You manage to convey the brooding atmosphere of the horticulture center so perfectly that the professor remains speechless for a good half a minute after you've finished speaking. He speaks after this pause.::

By the caverns, that is *un*believable, $(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName). The vegetation, the insects, the pesticide... amazing, truly amazing.

::The surreal nature of your visit to the Lemurian Health Center is difficult to express in mere words, but you do your best, and the professor follows your report with interest till the very end.::

I... don't know what to say, $(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName).

::You report all your findings while the professor, as always, listens with great attentiveness.::

A rather sad ending for the Lemurian Security Command, I have to say. Goodness me, you stood in the same room from which Lemurian officers, fathers, sons and husbands observed their home being demolished by the Biocorp Undernavy.
Tell me. Tell me everything.
Submarine? Oh, goodness me, that's quite a remarkable find. Shame it's so far away from here. How preserved is it?
At the-- A person? By the caverns!
Yahota,
Marcus,
Doctor Savage holds the highest rank,
::He takes a deep, shaky breath.:: Everyone is dead... I think the sec-chef holds the highest rank, but to be perfectly honest with you... I have no idea.

Yes, Marcus... ::He appears confused for a moment but the continues.:: Ahh... the sec-chef, yes, the sec-chef is in charge of payments now.

You'll find him in the camp's kitchen.

There are no records which could give us a clear answer, but as you've seen yourself, their usage of mutagen to eliminate Lemurians is a very good reason why they didn't immediately enter them. Now, after that...? Who knows.
::He makes a long, thoughtful pose.::
Right now we have a very good idea about how the

Ah, Jeremy, yes. Good fellow. One of the finest students at the Faculty of Information Technologies, and the head of the University's IT center. And he's been an assistant of mine in that field for a few years now.

Even though... his appearance might not suggest it in the least.
Security Agency, Bionic Institute, Nucleus Corporation, Transcendix. Alongside Biocorp and NFT they were the T6 - the six supercorporations of the pre-Descent times - the old world, if you prefer.

It wasn't my decision alone, $(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName), no, but they were my top choice as well. They are simply the best in the business of security contractors. Plenty of experience in most of these sec-troopers. Protectorate veterans, as you may know. They were an obvious choice for this kind of mission.
I'm afraid the expedition's finances do not concern you, $(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName), and they won't be discussed here.
Richard...
By the caverns...

::Your remark immediately grounds him.::

Yes... Oh, yes, you're right. I'm very sorry, I simply got carried away.

Oh... ::He pauses.:: I should tell him not to give him coffee.
Yes, yes, you've more than earned it.

::Nothing happens for the first few moments: He acts as if you've presented him with the most mundane of things. But then, as his eyes slowly focus on the big white letters, from capital A to capital R, life repermeates him.:: 

Acorn...

a sec-medic.

Right then. Forgive me but we will have to get straight to the point:
I forgot to mention $(#his/her) keen sense of humor, Professor.
We've been looking through some data in the Keep, or as we now know it as the Arch Island Keep, and have uncovered the locations of a couple of facilities I'd like you to investigate.
But one of the most important things is that you managed to find that dispatch console. They seem to be the key to discovering the locations of Lemurian facilities.
It's... such a shame you couldn't explore the entire facility. Who knows what other incredible things you would've discovered?
::Explain to him what you discovered.::

I believe.

The sec-troopers have contingency plans in case that their commanding officer or officers become in any way prevented from commanding them. Richard told me that, I remember. But the details of such I'm not familiar with. I'm sure they know what they're doing.

I, however, ultimately lead the expedition.
I'll go see him straight away then. Goodbye, Professor.

The Lemurians were the last enemies of the Biocorp Undernavy. After that, it was disbanded - under quite turbulent and unclear circumstances - and its assets were transferred to Biocorp Armed Forces, some of it later recycled, stored away, you know how it goes.
To that, I'm afraid... I couldn't possibly give you an answer.

Excellent.

Some... three to three and a half centuries ago this whole sea, this whole enormous cavern was chosen as the location of a major NFT project, the abbreviation standing for *New Frontier Technologies*, a supercorporation that can be said to have been comparable to Biocorp in power and influence; to Biocorp... *and* the other four supercorporations, to be exact.
They are dead now, Professor. They won't be bothering you no more.
I don't remember you mentioning we'll be facing anything like this before I took this job, Chief.

::He inspects his communicator.:: 

My battery must've died...

$(context.player.Name) - or Corporal, if so you prefer -
$(context.player.Name),
::The professor chuckles.:: Quite so.

Ah, yes - microchip encoder. That clearance level will certainly prove to be of great use, certainly.

::He makes a long pause.:: Goodness me...
::It takes a moment for him to respond.:: He's... one of the few left alive, I'm afraid. Yes. As simple as that.

Following that we can only speculate: Maybe these circumstances have simply led to Lemuria not being seen as important, or important enough. Maybe it was forgotten altogether. Maybe it was the mutagenic contamination that prevented it. 

Or perhaps it all came down to some higher interests - or more precisely *disinterests* we can't possibly perceive.
lived

Casual, yes.
Not the word to immediately come to mind, but something in that sense.

The late Chief...
Richard,

::He rubs one of his eyes.:: Yes?

By the caverns...

::As amazed as he without a doubt is, you can see it in his eyes that what he is waiting for you to tell him about something.::
::Wait as they lead him out.::
::End Dialog::

United Stations agent...

::He then looks at you with fearful eyes, as though you were someone else.::

I... I... Piss off!

::He slowly lowers his hands and looks at you with wide-open, bloodshot eyes. Then he grabs his head.::

You earned it.
Professor. $(context.player.Name).

::After taking a deep breath, the professor interjects.::

It was only a matter of time. ::He pauses.:: Reckon there's another way to settle this, Richard?
Chief Briggs and I had just been discussing you, and we've come to the conclusion that a person with your experience and skillset would be best assigned to one of the recovery teams.

Yes, Lemuria - this the name NFT gave to this project as well as the whole region itself. 

Lemuria... But more on that later.

Excellent work, $(context.npc_xpbl_oldfield_playerName).
I needed it to access Joint Security headquarters. There was a scanner there which wouldn't let me pass without an implant in my hand.
I need it to access Joint Security headquarters. There is a scanner there which won't let me pass without an implant in my hand.
I had a feeling I'd need that at some later point. Better do it while I'm there.

Yes... Yes. It's an interesting parallel to make, as fifteen years ago Biocorp Armed Forces officers too were looking down at Protectorate invaders breaking into and causing havoc in Dis. 

History tends to repeat itself, yet sadly it seems that with each iteration humanity loses more than it rebuilds, and some things are lost forever.
English
Acorn? ::He takes off his glasses for a moment.:: Could it be? How large is it then if...?
::Go and bring Todd to the camp.::
and traveled from facility to facility

But goodness me, he wasn't like that. He looked... normal - by our standards at least. 

It all began with his recent move to Hexagon...

As far as it's known, in the years before the Descent - the End of History as some old records call it - there were six supercorporations - big so-called "multinational" or "transnational" corporations, all members of the T6 group. 

There supercorporations were, by the end, the most powerful political entities of the pre-Descent world.

At some point in pre-Descent history, this group was formed in order for the supercorporations to collectively maintain, negotiate and defend their interests primarily against "nation states," which were these political entities unified by wholly different factors than those of supercorporations.
Like with NFT, information on them is difficult to come by these days. Plenty was lost as time went on. We do, thank goodness, still have sufficient information to get a sense of what they were.
Yes?

I had met him a few times; there were lectures of mine... unimportant. But goodness me, we didn't as much as strike up a conversation. Only when I needed to speak with him regarding his employment for the Black Sea expedition did we really, how should I say, get acquainted.
English
::Show him the Acorn.::

::He sits down and clutches the Acorn tightly, resting his face onto it and starts weeping. Every patron, thug and enforcer turn their attention to you two, and you realize it'd be the best you escort the professor to a safer place.::
::He then bows his head.::
Eh? ::He laughs.:: Honestly, I did not expect such language from a respected academic such as yourself.
English
::He shows him the Acorn.:: Is this what you were looking for?
English
But the Acorn we haven't been able to find, sadly.
English
::He shows him the Acorn.:: What can you tell me about this, professor? Do you recognize it?

Which means there is nothin' left for you to do here. And, really, nothin' left for us to ask you.
I told you, it's... it's NFT's terraforming technologies.
Tell me, who is financin' all of this? The money necessary for an expedition of this size has to come from a wealthy source.
Oh... ::He starts weeping.::

Jolly good.
Yes...
I need to speak to you about... the expedition.
